# atomic

**Type Property**

Whether writing is done atomically.

## Declaration

```swift
static var atomic: FileWrapper.WritingOptions { get }
```

## Discussion

You can use this option to ensure that, when overwriting a file package, the overwriting either completely succeeds or completely fails, with no possibility of leaving the file package in an inconsistent state. Because this option causes additional I/O, you shouldn’t use it unnecessarily. For example, don’t use this option in an override of `-[NSDocument` [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/write(to:ofType:)]`]`, because `NSDocument` safe-saving is already done atomically.

## Constants

- **withNameUpdating**: Whether descendant file wrappers’[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileWrapper/filename] properties are set if the writing succeeds.
